quiz_data.title: Q2 section 1
quiz_data.instructions: This is a closed book quiz. You have 10 minutes to complete it.

entry.title: Endogenous vs Exogenous Variables
entry.item_body:
In the context of the following model  classify the variables.

S

Source: MaCurdy, Thomas E. "An empirical model of labor supply in a life-cycle setting." Journal of political Economy 89, no. 6 (1981): 1059-1085.

entry.title: Lagrangian and recipe #1
entry.item_body:
Consider the problem of maximizing the following function subject to the equality constraint constraint; .

  1. Write the corresponding Lagrangian for this maximization problem.
  2. In words describe the steps of Recipe #1 to solve this problem. Mathematica notation is NOT required. Computations are NOT required. Please, try to describe it using short sentences.

                      <article class="post-3744 service type-service status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry">
    <header>
    <div class="page-header">
      <h1 class="entry-title">Canvas</h1>
    </div>
      <time class="published" datetime="2022-06-27T17:26:39-04:00">June 27, 2022</time> <p class="byline author vcard"> <span class="author vcard">By <a class="fn" href="https://edtech.unc.edu/author/tntu/"  rel="author">Thao Nghi Tu</a></span></p>    </header>
    <div class="entry-content">
      <script>

    (function($) {
        $("body, html").addClass("heels_full_width_overflow");
    })(jQuery);

   </script>
   <div style="background-color:#f5f5f5; background-image: url(https://edtech.unc.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/1218/2025/08/003322_campus_scenes307_crop-scaled.jpg);" data-speed="18" id="parallax-section" data-type="background" class="full-width-contained whitebackground service-parallax">
<div class="row  oscitas-bootstrap-container">
<div class="col-lg-6 col-md-12 col-xs-12 col-sm-12 oscitas-bootstrap-container">
<div class="service-title-container"><h1>Canvas</h1></div>
</div>
<div class="col-lg-6 col-md-12 col-xs-12 col-sm-12 oscitas-bootstrap-container">
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="navbar-container container">

<div id="second-nav">
<ul class="nav-2 navbar-nav-2">
 <h3>Jump to:</h3>

<li><a href="#site-request">Site Request</a></li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-faq/">FAQ</a></li>
  <li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-policies/">Policies</a></li>
  <li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a></li>

<button onclick="topFunction()" id="topBtn" title="Go to top">↑ Top</button>
<p><a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/saml"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Onyen Login</a>   <a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/canvas"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Non-Onyen Login</a></p>
<p><strong>Separate Logins</strong>: <a href="https://kenan-flagler.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Kenan-Flagler Business School</a> | <a href="https://digitalcampus.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">MPH@UNC</a> | <a href="https://sogunc.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">School of Government Non-Degree Courses</a></p>
<p>Canvas replaced Sakai as the University’s learning management system after the Spring 2024 semester concluded. Learn more about the <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/transition-to-canvas/">transition to Canvas</a>.<a name="training-support"></a></p>
<h2>Training and Support</h2>
<h3>Canvas Help Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Help</strong> menu within Canvas: <strong>24/7 chat and phone support</strong></li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a>: UNC training videos and resources to help instructors move from Sakai to Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-faq/">UNC Canvas FAQ</a>: Curated list of guides to help users get started in Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Instructor/ct-p/canvas_instructor" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Instructor Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Student/ct-p/canvas_student" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Student Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">UNC Help</a>: <strong>Go through help.unc.edu for UNC-specific questions only, including:<br />
</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Accessing sites from past semesters or for Incomplete grades</li>
<li>Panopto, Poll Everywhere, VoiceThread, Zoom</li>
<li>Renaming sites</li>
<li>Roster issues</li>
<li>Sakai</li>
<li>De-crosslisting manually cross-listed sites</li>
<li>Other administrative assistance</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>All other questions about how to use Canvas or issues should go through Canvas Support (Help menu within Canvas).<a name="training"></a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Canvas Training</h3>
<h4>Personal Consultations</h4>
<p>Need one-on-one help with Canvas? Sign up for a <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/personal-consultations/">personal consultation</a> to meet with an ITS-EdTech member over Zoom! You can also <a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">submit a help request</a> if you would like to schedule a departmental training.</p>
<h4>Group Training</h4>
<p>See what <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/workshops/">workshops</a> we’re currently offering to learn more about Canvas with other instructors!</p>
<h4>Self-Help Resources</h4>
<p>See <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a> for video tutorials and guides to help instructors transition from Sakai to Canvas with tool comparisons between the two systems. This resource provides an overview of commonly used tools for instructors to manage their courses, communicate and share course materials with students, and collect and provide feedback on student work.<a name="site-request"></a></p>
<h2>Request Forms</h2>
<p><strong>Note</strong>: Faculty/Staff Onyen required to access request forms.</p>
<h3>New Site Request Form</h3>
<p><a href="https://checkindash.unc.edu/secure/canvas-request.php" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>New Site Request Form</strong></a>: Submit site requests for a brand new Canvas site for course development or training, instructional, or administrative purposes (committee work, communications, reviews, etc.).</p>
<h3>Additional Sakai to Canvas Migration</h3>
<p>Sakai migrations have been completed for University Registrar courses taught in 2022, 2023, and Spring 2024. The additional migration request form is now closed.</p>
<p><span class="TextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9" lang="EN-US" xml:lang="EN-US" data-contrast="auto"><span class="NormalTextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9"><strong>Note:</strong> If you require any Sakai content from course sites (pre-SP22) or project sites for re-use in Canvas, please refer to instructions on how to <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/getting-course-content-into-canvas/#export-sakai">migrate content from Sakai yourself</a>.</span></span><a name="guest"></a></p>
<h3>Guest Accounts</h3>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Non-Onyen guest accounts may be created for individuals not eligible for an Onyen account who will serve in instructional, advisory, or other coordinating roles in Canvas sites. Guest accounts can also be created for students from other institutions enrolled in credit-bearing courses at UNC-CH as well as for students enrolled in non-credit bearing courses or training sponsored by a UNC-CH operating unit. Only users with the role of Teacher, TA, Designer, Dean Designate, or Tech Support can create a guest account from their site. <strong>Important</strong>: Once created, active guest accounts are valid indefinitely but will be suspended after one year of inactivity (i.e., user unable to log in) and deleted after four years of inactivity (i.e., all data removed).</span></p>
<div role="tablist" class="panel-group yourcustomclass oscitas-bootstrap-container" id="unc-accordion-0">
<div class="panel panel-default oscitas-bootstrap-container">

    <div id="panel-heading-details-0-0" class="panel-heading oscitas-bootstrap-container" role="tab">

        <h4 class="panel-title oscitas-bootstrap-container">

            <button class="accordion-toggle oscitas-bootstrap-container collapsed" 
                id = "button-details-0-0"
                data-toggle="collapse"
                data-parent="#unc-accordion-0"    
                aria-controls="#details-0-0"  
                aria-expanded="false" 
                href="#details-0-0">
                Access instructions to create a Canvas guest account            </button>

        </h4>

    </div>

    <div id="details-0-0" class="panel-collapse collapse  oscitas-bootstrap-container">

        <div class="panel-body oscitas-bootstrap-container"></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">All UNC-Chapel Hill Faculty, Students, and Staff who have an active Onyen have access to Canvas. Rosters are added automatically to Canvas for official course sites based on enrollment data in ConnectCarolina.</span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">If needed, you may add other UNC-Chapel Hill users to your Canvas sites. For example: tech support, instructional designers, departmental colleagues, or students not on the roster. To do this, go to the site and select People > +People > select Login ID > enter their Onyen > select role > Next > Add User.</span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Only complete the following steps if you need to </span><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Instructor-Guide/How-do-I-add-users-to-a-course/ta-p/1119" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span data-contrast="none">add a user to your Canvas site</span></a><span data-contrast="auto"> who </span><b><span data-contrast="auto">does not have an Onyen.</span></b><span data-contrast="auto"> Note: Only Teachers, TAs, Designers, and Tech Support can create users in their sites. </span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559685":0,"335559737":0,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<ol>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to your site where you would like to add a guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to <strong>People</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>People+</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select <strong>Login ID</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Enter the guest’s Email address in the box</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select a <strong>Role</strong> and <strong>Section</strong> for the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Check the box if the guest should only interact with this section</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> Button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">If the guest does not have an account in Canvas, you will receive the following message: “We were unable to find matches below. Select any you would like to create as new users. Unselected will be skipped at this time.”</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Carefully check the box next to the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Type their Full Name into the Name box (e.g. “First Last”)</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Confirm that the guest’s name and email are correct</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Add Users</strong> button</span></li>
</ol>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will then be added to the site with Pending status. </span><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will also receive an email from Instructure Canvas with steps to create their account. <strong>Important:</strong> The guest should respond that they <strong>Do Not have a Canvas account</strong> (in our UNC-CH instance) if prompted during setup, even if they have one at another institution. </span><span data-contrast="auto">After creating their account, the guest will be able to log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu using the Non-Onyen Login button. <strong>Note: </strong>Users may be added to sites during the current term but not after courses have concluded.<br />
</span></p>
<p></div>

    </div>
        
</div></div>

//Get the button:

// When the user scrolls down 20px from the top of the document, show the button
window.onscroll = function() {scrollFunction()};

function scrollFunction() {
  if (document.body.scrollTop > 20 || document.documentElement.scrollTop > 20) {
    mybutton.style.display = "block";
  } else {
    mybutton.style.display = "none";
  }
}

// When the user clicks on the button, scroll to the top of the document
function topFunction() {
  document.body.scrollTop = 0; // For Safari
  document.documentElement.scrollTop = 0; // For Chrome, Firefox, IE and Opera
}

                      <article class="post-3744 service type-service status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry">
    <header>
    <div class="page-header">
      <h1 class="entry-title">Canvas</h1>
    </div>
      <time class="published" datetime="2022-06-27T17:26:39-04:00">June 27, 2022</time> <p class="byline author vcard"> <span class="author vcard">By <a class="fn" href="https://edtech.unc.edu/author/tntu/"  rel="author">Thao Nghi Tu</a></span></p>    </header>
    <div class="entry-content">
      <script>

    (function($) {
        $("body, html").addClass("heels_full_width_overflow");
    })(jQuery);

   </script>
   <div style="background-color:#f5f5f5; background-image: url(https://edtech.unc.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/1218/2025/08/003322_campus_scenes307_crop-scaled.jpg);" data-speed="18" id="parallax-section" data-type="background" class="full-width-contained whitebackground service-parallax">
<div class="row  oscitas-bootstrap-container">
<div class="col-lg-6 col-md-12 col-xs-12 col-sm-12 oscitas-bootstrap-container">
<div class="service-title-container"><h1>Canvas</h1></div>
</div>
<div class="col-lg-6 col-md-12 col-xs-12 col-sm-12 oscitas-bootstrap-container">
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="navbar-container container">

<div id="second-nav">
<ul class="nav-2 navbar-nav-2">
 <h3>Jump to:</h3>  







  
  
  <li><a href="#training-support">Training and Support</a></li>
<li><a href="#site-request">Site Request</a></li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-faq/">FAQ</a></li>
  <li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-policies/">Policies</a></li>
  <li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a></li>

 </div>
</div>
<button onclick="topFunction()" id="topBtn" title="Go to top">↑ Top</button>
<p><a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/saml"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Onyen Login</a>   <a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/canvas"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Non-Onyen Login</a></p>
<p><strong>Separate Logins</strong>: <a href="https://kenan-flagler.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Kenan-Flagler Business School</a> | <a href="https://digitalcampus.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">MPH@UNC</a> | <a href="https://sogunc.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">School of Government Non-Degree Courses</a></p>
<p>Canvas replaced Sakai as the University’s learning management system after the Spring 2024 semester concluded. Learn more about the <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/transition-to-canvas/">transition to Canvas</a>.<a name="training-support"></a></p>
<h2>Training and Support</h2>
<h3>Canvas Help Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Help</strong> menu within Canvas: <strong>24/7 chat and phone support</strong></li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a>: UNC training videos and resources to help instructors move from Sakai to Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-faq/">UNC Canvas FAQ</a>: Curated list of guides to help users get started in Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Instructor/ct-p/canvas_instructor" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Instructor Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Student/ct-p/canvas_student" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Student Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">UNC Help</a>: <strong>Go through help.unc.edu for UNC-specific questions only, including:<br />
</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Accessing sites from past semesters or for Incomplete grades</li>
<li>Panopto, Poll Everywhere, VoiceThread, Zoom</li>
<li>Renaming sites</li>
<li>Roster issues</li>
<li>Sakai</li>
<li>De-crosslisting manually cross-listed sites</li>
<li>Other administrative assistance</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>All other questions about how to use Canvas or issues should go through Canvas Support (Help menu within Canvas).<a name="training"></a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Canvas Training</h3>
<h4>Personal Consultations</h4>
<p>Need one-on-one help with Canvas? Sign up for a <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/personal-consultations/">personal consultation</a> to meet with an ITS-EdTech member over Zoom! You can also <a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">submit a help request</a> if you would like to schedule a departmental training.</p>
<h4>Group Training</h4>
<p>See what <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/workshops/">workshops</a> we’re currently offering to learn more about Canvas with other instructors!</p>
<h4>Self-Help Resources</h4>
<p>See <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a> for video tutorials and guides to help instructors transition from Sakai to Canvas with tool comparisons between the two systems. This resource provides an overview of commonly used tools for instructors to manage their courses, communicate and share course materials with students, and collect and provide feedback on student work.<a name="site-request"></a></p>
<h2>Request Forms</h2>
<p><strong>Note</strong>: Faculty/Staff Onyen required to access request forms.</p>
<h3>New Site Request Form</h3>
<p><a href="https://checkindash.unc.edu/secure/canvas-request.php" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>New Site Request Form</strong></a>: Submit site requests for a brand new Canvas site for course development or training, instructional, or administrative purposes (committee work, communications, reviews, etc.).</p>
<h3>Additional Sakai to Canvas Migration</h3>
<p>Sakai migrations have been completed for University Registrar courses taught in 2022, 2023, and Spring 2024. The additional migration request form is now closed.</p>
<p><span class="TextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9" lang="EN-US" xml:lang="EN-US" data-contrast="auto"><span class="NormalTextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9"><strong>Note:</strong> If you require any Sakai content from course sites (pre-SP22) or project sites for re-use in Canvas, please refer to instructions on how to <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/getting-course-content-into-canvas/#export-sakai">migrate content from Sakai yourself</a>.</span></span><a name="guest"></a></p>
<h3>Guest Accounts</h3>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Non-Onyen guest accounts may be created for individuals not eligible for an Onyen account who will serve in instructional, advisory, or other coordinating roles in Canvas sites. Guest accounts can also be created for students from other institutions enrolled in credit-bearing courses at UNC-CH as well as for students enrolled in non-credit bearing courses or training sponsored by a UNC-CH operating unit. Only users with the role of Teacher, TA, Designer, Dean Designate, or Tech Support can create a guest account from their site. <strong>Important</strong>: Once created, active guest accounts are valid indefinitely but will be suspended after one year of inactivity (i.e., user unable to log in) and deleted after four years of inactivity (i.e., all data removed).</span></p>
<div role="tablist" class="panel-group yourcustomclass oscitas-bootstrap-container" id="unc-accordion-0">
<div class="panel panel-default oscitas-bootstrap-container">

    <div id="panel-heading-details-0-0" class="panel-heading oscitas-bootstrap-container" role="tab">

        <h4 class="panel-title oscitas-bootstrap-container">

            <button class="accordion-toggle oscitas-bootstrap-container collapsed" 
                id = "button-details-0-0"
                data-toggle="collapse"
                data-parent="#unc-accordion-0"    
                aria-controls="#details-0-0"  
                aria-expanded="false" 
                href="#details-0-0">
                Access instructions to create a Canvas guest account            </button>

        </h4>

    </div>

    <div id="details-0-0" class="panel-collapse collapse  oscitas-bootstrap-container">

        <div class="panel-body oscitas-bootstrap-container"></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">All UNC-Chapel Hill Faculty, Students, and Staff who have an active Onyen have access to Canvas. Rosters are added automatically to Canvas for official course sites based on enrollment data in ConnectCarolina.</span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">If needed, you may add other UNC-Chapel Hill users to your Canvas sites. For example: tech support, instructional designers, departmental colleagues, or students not on the roster. To do this, go to the site and select People > +People > select Login ID > enter their Onyen > select role > Next > Add User.</span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Only complete the following steps if you need to </span><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Instructor-Guide/How-do-I-add-users-to-a-course/ta-p/1119" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span data-contrast="none">add a user to your Canvas site</span></a><span data-contrast="auto"> who </span><b><span data-contrast="auto">does not have an Onyen.</span></b><span data-contrast="auto"> Note: Only Teachers, TAs, Designers, and Tech Support can create users in their sites. </span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559685":0,"335559737":0,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<ol>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to your site where you would like to add a guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to <strong>People</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>People+</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select <strong>Login ID</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Enter the guest’s Email address in the box</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select a <strong>Role</strong> and <strong>Section</strong> for the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Check the box if the guest should only interact with this section</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> Button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">If the guest does not have an account in Canvas, you will receive the following message: “We were unable to find matches below. Select any you would like to create as new users. Unselected will be skipped at this time.”</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Carefully check the box next to the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Type their Full Name into the Name box (e.g. “First Last”)</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Confirm that the guest’s name and email are correct</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Add Users</strong> button</span></li>
</ol>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will then be added to the site with Pending status. </span><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will also receive an email from Instructure Canvas with steps to create their account. <strong>Important:</strong> The guest should respond that they <strong>Do Not have a Canvas account</strong> (in our UNC-CH instance) if prompted during setup, even if they have one at another institution. </span><span data-contrast="auto">After creating their account, the guest will be able to log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu using the Non-Onyen Login button. <strong>Note: </strong>Users may be added to sites during the current term but not after courses have concluded.<br />
</span></p>
<p></div>

    </div>

<script type="text/javascript">
//-----------------------------------------
// Content Template: service-single-view - start
//-----------------------------------------
jQuery(document).ready(function ($){
  $('.breadcrumbs').insertAfter('#parallax-section');
     })

//Get the button:
mybutton = document.getElementById("topBtn");

// When the user scrolls down 20px from the top of the document, show the button
window.onscroll = function() {scrollFunction()};

function scrollFunction() {
  if (document.body.scrollTop > 20 || document.documentElement.scrollTop > 20) {
    mybutton.style.display = "block";
  } else {
    mybutton.style.display = "none";
  }
}

// When the user clicks on the button, scroll to the top of the document
function topFunction() {
  document.body.scrollTop = 0; // For Safari
  document.documentElement.scrollTop = 0; // For Chrome, Firefox, IE and Opera
}

// Content Template: service-single-view - end

// Content Template: search-widget-insert - start

jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
  $('.search-form').wrap('<li class="navbar-search"></li>');
  $('ul.navbar-nav').append($('.navbar-search'));
});
//-----------------------------------------
// Content Template: search-widget-insert - end
//-----------------------------------------

<p><a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/saml"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Onyen Login</a>   <a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/canvas"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Non-Onyen Login</a></p>
<p><strong>Separate Logins</strong>: <a href="https://kenan-flagler.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Kenan-Flagler Business School</a> | <a href="https://digitalcampus.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">MPH@UNC</a> | <a href="https://sogunc.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">School of Government Non-Degree Courses</a></p>
<p>Canvas replaced Sakai as the University’s learning management system after the Spring 2024 semester concluded. Learn more about the <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/transition-to-canvas/">transition to Canvas</a>.<a name="training-support"></a></p>
<h2>Training and Support</h2>
<h3>Canvas Help Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Help</strong> menu within Canvas: <strong>24/7 chat and phone support</strong></li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a>: UNC training videos and resources to help instructors move from Sakai to Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-faq/">UNC Canvas FAQ</a>: Curated list of guides to help users get started in Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Instructor/ct-p/canvas_instructor" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Instructor Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Student/ct-p/canvas_student" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Student Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">UNC Help</a>: <strong>Go through help.unc.edu for UNC-specific questions only, including:<br />
</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Accessing sites from past semesters or for Incomplete grades</li>
<li>Panopto, Poll Everywhere, VoiceThread, Zoom</li>
<li>Renaming sites</li>
<li>Roster issues</li>
<li>Sakai</li>
<li>De-crosslisting manually cross-listed sites</li>
<li>Other administrative assistance</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>All other questions about how to use Canvas or issues should go through Canvas Support (Help menu within Canvas).<a name="training"></a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Canvas Training</h3>
<h4>Personal Consultations</h4>
<p>Need one-on-one help with Canvas? Sign up for a <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/personal-consultations/">personal consultation</a> to meet with an ITS-EdTech member over Zoom! You can also <a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">submit a help request</a> if you would like to schedule a departmental training.</p>
<h4>Group Training</h4>
<p>See what <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/workshops/">workshops</a> we’re currently offering to learn more about Canvas with other instructors!</p>
<h4>Self-Help Resources</h4>
<p>See <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a> for video tutorials and guides to help instructors transition from Sakai to Canvas with tool comparisons between the two systems. This resource provides an overview of commonly used tools for instructors to manage their courses, communicate and share course materials with students, and collect and provide feedback on student work.<a name="site-request"></a></p>
<h2>Request Forms</h2>
<p><strong>Note</strong>: Faculty/Staff Onyen required to access request forms.</p>
<h3>New Site Request Form</h3>
<p><a href="https://checkindash.unc.edu/secure/canvas-request.php" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>New Site Request Form</strong></a>: Submit site requests for a brand new Canvas site for course development or training, instructional, or administrative purposes (committee work, communications, reviews, etc.).</p>
<h3>Additional Sakai to Canvas Migration</h3>
<p>Sakai migrations have been completed for University Registrar courses taught in 2022, 2023, and Spring 2024. The additional migration request form is now closed.</p>
<p><span class="TextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9" lang="EN-US" xml:lang="EN-US" data-contrast="auto"><span class="NormalTextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9"><strong>Note:</strong> If you require any Sakai content from course sites (pre-SP22) or project sites for re-use in Canvas, please refer to instructions on how to <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/getting-course-content-into-canvas/#export-sakai">migrate content from Sakai yourself</a>.</span></span><a name="guest"></a></p>
<h3>Guest Accounts</h3>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Non-Onyen guest accounts may be created for individuals not eligible for an Onyen account who will serve in instructional, advisory, or other coordinating roles in Canvas sites. Guest accounts can also be created for students from other institutions enrolled in credit-bearing courses at UNC-CH as well as for students enrolled in non-credit bearing courses or training sponsored by a UNC-CH operating unit. Only users with the role of Teacher, TA, Designer, Dean Designate, or Tech Support can create a guest account from their site. <strong>Important</strong>: Once created, active guest accounts are valid indefinitely but will be suspended after one year of inactivity (i.e., user unable to log in) and deleted after four years of inactivity (i.e., all data removed).</span></p>
<div role="tablist" class="panel-group yourcustomclass oscitas-bootstrap-container" id="unc-accordion-0">
<div class="panel panel-default oscitas-bootstrap-container">

    <div id="panel-heading-details-0-0" class="panel-heading oscitas-bootstrap-container" role="tab">

        <h4 class="panel-title oscitas-bootstrap-container">

            <button class="accordion-toggle oscitas-bootstrap-container collapsed" 
                id = "button-details-0-0"
                data-toggle="collapse"
                data-parent="#unc-accordion-0"    
                aria-controls="#details-0-0"  
                aria-expanded="false" 
                href="#details-0-0">
                Access instructions to create a Canvas guest account            </button>

        </h4>

    </div>

    <div id="details-0-0" class="panel-collapse collapse  oscitas-bootstrap-container">

        <div class="panel-body oscitas-bootstrap-container"></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">All UNC-Chapel Hill Faculty, Students, and Staff who have an active Onyen have access to Canvas. Rosters are added automatically to Canvas for official course sites based on enrollment data in ConnectCarolina.</span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">If needed, you may add other UNC-Chapel Hill users to your Canvas sites. For example: tech support, instructional designers, departmental colleagues, or students not on the roster. To do this, go to the site and select People > +People > select Login ID > enter their Onyen > select role > Next > Add User.</span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Only complete the following steps if you need to </span><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Instructor-Guide/How-do-I-add-users-to-a-course/ta-p/1119" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span data-contrast="none">add a user to your Canvas site</span></a><span data-contrast="auto"> who </span><b><span data-contrast="auto">does not have an Onyen.</span></b><span data-contrast="auto"> Note: Only Teachers, TAs, Designers, and Tech Support can create users in their sites. </span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559685":0,"335559737":0,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<ol>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to your site where you would like to add a guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to <strong>People</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>People+</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select <strong>Login ID</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Enter the guest’s Email address in the box</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select a <strong>Role</strong> and <strong>Section</strong> for the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Check the box if the guest should only interact with this section</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> Button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">If the guest does not have an account in Canvas, you will receive the following message: “We were unable to find matches below. Select any you would like to create as new users. Unselected will be skipped at this time.”</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Carefully check the box next to the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Type their Full Name into the Name box (e.g. “First Last”)</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Confirm that the guest’s name and email are correct</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Add Users</strong> button</span></li>
</ol>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will then be added to the site with Pending status. </span><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will also receive an email from Instructure Canvas with steps to create their account. <strong>Important:</strong> The guest should respond that they <strong>Do Not have a Canvas account</strong> (in our UNC-CH instance) if prompted during setup, even if they have one at another institution. </span><span data-contrast="auto">After creating their account, the guest will be able to log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu using the Non-Onyen Login button. <strong>Note: </strong>Users may be added to sites during the current term but not after courses have concluded.<br />
</span></p>
<p></div>

//Get the button:
mybutton = document.getElementById("topBtn");

// When the user scrolls down 20px from the top of the document, show the button
window.onscroll = function() {scrollFunction()};

function scrollFunction() {
  if (document.body.scrollTop > 20 || document.documentElement.scrollTop > 20) {
    mybutton.style.display = "block";
  } else {
    mybutton.style.display = "none";
  }
}

// When the user clicks on the button, scroll to the top of the document
function topFunction() {
  document.body.scrollTop = 0; // For Safari
  document.documentElement.scrollTop = 0; // For Chrome, Firefox, IE and Opera
}

                      <article class="post-3744 service type-service status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry">
    <header>
    <div class="page-header">
      <h1 class="entry-title">Canvas</h1>
    </div>
      <time class="published" datetime="2022-06-27T17:26:39-04:00">June 27, 2022</time> <p class="byline author vcard"> <span class="author vcard">By <a class="fn" href="https://edtech.unc.edu/author/tntu/"  rel="author">Thao Nghi Tu</a></span></p>    </header>
    <div class="entry-content">
      <script>

    (function($) {
        $("body, html").addClass("heels_full_width_overflow");
    })(jQuery);

   </script>
   <div style="background-color:#f5f5f5; background-image: url(https://edtech.unc.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/1218/2025/08/003322_campus_scenes307_crop-scaled.jpg);" data-speed="18" id="parallax-section" data-type="background" class="full-width-contained whitebackground service-parallax">
<div class="row  oscitas-bootstrap-container">
<div class="col-lg-6 col-md-12 col-xs-12 col-sm-12 oscitas-bootstrap-container">
<div class="service-title-container"><h1>Canvas</h1></div>
</div>
<div class="col-lg-6 col-md-12 col-xs-12 col-sm-12 oscitas-bootstrap-container">
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="navbar-container container">

<div id="second-nav">
<ul class="nav-2 navbar-nav-2">
 <h3>Jump to:</h3>

<li><a href="#site-request">Site Request</a></li>

  <li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a></li>

 </div>
</div>
<button onclick="topFunction()" id="topBtn" title="Go to top">↑ Top</button>
<p><a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/saml"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Onyen Login</a>   <a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/canvas"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Non-Onyen Login</a></p>
<p><strong>Separate Logins</strong>: <a href="https://kenan-flagler.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Kenan-Flagler Business School</a> | <a href="https://digitalcampus.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">MPH@UNC</a> | <a href="https://sogunc.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">School of Government Non-Degree Courses</a></p>
<p>Canvas replaced Sakai as the University’s learning management system after the Spring 2024 semester concluded. Learn more about the <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/transition-to-canvas/">transition to Canvas</a>.<a name="training-support"></a></p>
<h2>Training and Support</h2>
<h3>Canvas Help Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Help</strong> menu within Canvas: <strong>24/7 chat and phone support</strong></li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a>: UNC training videos and resources to help instructors move from Sakai to Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-faq/">UNC Canvas FAQ</a>: Curated list of guides to help users get started in Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Instructor/ct-p/canvas_instructor" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Instructor Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Student/ct-p/canvas_student" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Student Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">UNC Help</a>: <strong>Go through help.unc.edu for UNC-specific questions only, including:<br />
</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Accessing sites from past semesters or for Incomplete grades</li>
<li>Panopto, Poll Everywhere, VoiceThread, Zoom</li>
<li>Renaming sites</li>
<li>Roster issues</li>
<li>Sakai</li>
<li>De-crosslisting manually cross-listed sites</li>
<li>Other administrative assistance</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>All other questions about how to use Canvas or issues should go through Canvas Support (Help menu within Canvas).<a name="training"></a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Canvas Training</h3>
<h4>Personal Consultations</h4>
<p>Need one-on-one help with Canvas? Sign up for a <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/personal-consultations/">personal consultation</a> to meet with an ITS-EdTech member over Zoom! You can also <a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">submit a help request</a> if you would like to schedule a departmental training.</p>
<h4>Group Training</h4>
<p>See what <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/workshops/">workshops</a> we’re currently offering to learn more about Canvas with other instructors!</p>
<h4>Self-Help Resources</h4>
<p>See <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a> for video tutorials and guides to help instructors transition from Sakai to Canvas with tool comparisons between the two systems. This resource provides an overview of commonly used tools for instructors to manage their courses, communicate and share course materials with students, and collect and provide feedback on student work.<a name="site-request"></a></p>
<h2>Request Forms</h2>
<p><strong>Note</strong>: Faculty/Staff Onyen required to access request forms.</p>
<h3>New Site Request Form</h3>
<p><a href="https://checkindash.unc.edu/secure/canvas-request.php" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>New Site Request Form</strong></a>: Submit site requests for a brand new Canvas site for course development or training, instructional, or administrative purposes (committee work, communications, reviews, etc.).</p>
<h3>Additional Sakai to Canvas Migration</h3>
<p>Sakai migrations have been completed for University Registrar courses taught in 2022, 2023, and Spring 2024. The additional migration request form is now closed.</p>
<p><span class="TextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9" lang="EN-US" xml:lang="EN-US" data-contrast="auto"><span class="NormalTextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9"><strong>Note:</strong> If you require any Sakai content from course sites (pre-SP22) or project sites for re-use in Canvas, please refer to instructions on how to <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/getting-course-content-into-canvas/#export-sakai">migrate content from Sakai yourself</a>.</span></span><a name="guest"></a></p>
<h3>Guest Accounts</h3>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Non-Onyen guest accounts may be created for individuals not eligible for an Onyen account who will serve in instructional, advisory, or other coordinating roles in Canvas sites. Guest accounts can also be created for students from other institutions enrolled in credit-bearing courses at UNC-CH as well as for students enrolled in non-credit bearing courses or training sponsored by a UNC-CH operating unit. Only users with the role of Teacher, TA, Designer, Dean Designate, or Tech Support can create a guest account from their site. <strong>Important</strong>: Once created, active guest accounts are valid indefinitely but will be suspended after one year of inactivity (i.e., user unable to log in) and deleted after four years of inactivity (i.e., all data removed).</span></p>
<div role="tablist" class="panel-group yourcustomclass oscitas-bootstrap-container" id="unc-accordion-0">
<div class="panel panel-default oscitas-bootstrap-container">

    <div id="panel-heading-details-0-0" class="panel-heading oscitas-bootstrap-container" role="tab">

        <h4 class="panel-title oscitas-bootstrap-container">

            <button class="accordion-toggle oscitas-bootstrap-container collapsed" 
                id = "button-details-0-0"
                data-toggle="collapse"
                data-parent="#unc-accordion-0"    
                aria-controls="#details-0-0"  
                aria-expanded="false" 
                href="#details-0-0">
                Access instructions to create a Canvas guest account            </button>

        </h4>

    </div>

    <div id="details-0-0" class="panel-collapse collapse  oscitas-bootstrap-container">

        <div class="panel-body oscitas-bootstrap-container"></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">All UNC-Chapel Hill Faculty, Students, and Staff who have an active Onyen have access to Canvas. Rosters are added automatically to Canvas for official course sites based on enrollment data in ConnectCarolina.</span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">If needed, you may add other UNC-Chapel Hill users to your Canvas sites. For example: tech support, instructional designers, departmental colleagues, or students not on the roster. To do this, go to the site and select People > +People > select Login ID > enter their Onyen > select role > Next > Add User.</span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Only complete the following steps if you need to </span><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Instructor-Guide/How-do-I-add-users-to-a-course/ta-p/1119" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span data-contrast="none">add a user to your Canvas site</span></a><span data-contrast="auto"> who </span><b><span data-contrast="auto">does not have an Onyen.</span></b><span data-contrast="auto"> Note: Only Teachers, TAs, Designers, and Tech Support can create users in their sites. </span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559685":0,"335559737":0,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<ol>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to your site where you would like to add a guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to <strong>People</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>People+</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select <strong>Login ID</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Enter the guest’s Email address in the box</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select a <strong>Role</strong> and <strong>Section</strong> for the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Check the box if the guest should only interact with this section</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> Button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">If the guest does not have an account in Canvas, you will receive the following message: “We were unable to find matches below. Select any you would like to create as new users. Unselected will be skipped at this time.”</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Carefully check the box next to the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Type their Full Name into the Name box (e.g. “First Last”)</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Confirm that the guest’s name and email are correct</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Add Users</strong> button</span></li>
</ol>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will then be added to the site with Pending status. </span><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will also receive an email from Instructure Canvas with steps to create their account. <strong>Important:</strong> The guest should respond that they <strong>Do Not have a Canvas account</strong> (in our UNC-CH instance) if prompted during setup, even if they have one at another institution. </span><span data-contrast="auto">After creating their account, the guest will be able to log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu using the Non-Onyen Login button. <strong>Note: </strong>Users may be added to sites during the current term but not after courses have concluded.<br />
</span></p>
<p></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
//-----------------------------------------
// Content Template: service-single-view - start
//-----------------------------------------
jQuery(document).ready(function ($){
  $('.breadcrumbs').insertAfter('#parallax-section');
     })

//Get the button:
mybutton = document.getElementById("topBtn");

// When the user scrolls down 20px from the top of the document, show the button
window.onscroll = function() {scrollFunction()};

function scrollFunction() {
  if (document.body.scrollTop > 20 || document.documentElement.scrollTop > 20) {
    mybutton.style.display = "block";
  } else {
    mybutton.style.display = "none";
  }
}

// When the user clicks on the button, scroll to the top of the document
function topFunction() {
  document.body.scrollTop = 0; // For Safari
  document.documentElement.scrollTop = 0; // For Chrome, Firefox, IE and Opera
}
//-----------------------------------------
// Content Template: service-single-view - end
//-----------------------------------------

// Content Template: search-widget-insert - start
//-----------------------------------------
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
  $('.search-form').wrap('<li class="navbar-search"></li>');
  $('ul.navbar-nav').append($('.navbar-search'));
});
//-----------------------------------------
// Content Template: search-widget-insert - end
//-----------------------------------------
</script>

                      <article class="post-3744 service type-service status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry">
    <header>
    <div class="page-header">
      <h1 class="entry-title">Canvas</h1>
    </div>
      <time class="published" datetime="2022-06-27T17:26:39-04:00">June 27, 2022</time> <p class="byline author vcard"> <span class="author vcard">By <a class="fn" href="https://edtech.unc.edu/author/tntu/"  rel="author">Thao Nghi Tu</a></span></p>    </header>
    <div class="entry-content">
      <script>

    (function($) {
        $("body, html").addClass("heels_full_width_overflow");
    })(jQuery);

   </script>
   <div style="background-color:#f5f5f5; background-image: url(https://edtech.unc.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/1218/2025/08/003322_campus_scenes307_crop-scaled.jpg);" data-speed="18" id="parallax-section" data-type="background" class="full-width-contained whitebackground service-parallax">

<button onclick="topFunction()" id="topBtn" title="Go to top">↑ Top</button>
<p><a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/saml"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Onyen Login</a>   <a class="btn btn-primary btn-lg  oscitas-bootstrap-container" target="_self" href="https://uncch.instructure.com/login/canvas"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user" ></i> Non-Onyen Login</a></p>
<p><strong>Separate Logins</strong>: <a href="https://kenan-flagler.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Kenan-Flagler Business School</a> | <a href="https://digitalcampus.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">MPH@UNC</a> | <a href="https://sogunc.instructure.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">School of Government Non-Degree Courses</a></p>
<p>Canvas replaced Sakai as the University’s learning management system after the Spring 2024 semester concluded. Learn more about the <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/transition-to-canvas/">transition to Canvas</a>.<a name="training-support"></a></p>
<h2>Training and Support</h2>
<h3>Canvas Help Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Help</strong> menu within Canvas: <strong>24/7 chat and phone support</strong></li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a>: UNC training videos and resources to help instructors move from Sakai to Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/canvas-faq/">UNC Canvas FAQ</a>: Curated list of guides to help users get started in Canvas</li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Instructor/ct-p/canvas_instructor" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Instructor Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Canvas-Student/ct-p/canvas_student" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Student Guides and Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">UNC Help</a>: <strong>Go through help.unc.edu for UNC-specific questions only, including:<br />
</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Accessing sites from past semesters or for Incomplete grades</li>
<li>Panopto, Poll Everywhere, VoiceThread, Zoom</li>
<li>Renaming sites</li>
<li>Roster issues</li>
<li>Sakai</li>
<li>De-crosslisting manually cross-listed sites</li>
<li>Other administrative assistance</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>All other questions about how to use Canvas or issues should go through Canvas Support (Help menu within Canvas).<a name="training"></a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Canvas Training</h3>
<h4>Personal Consultations</h4>
<p>Need one-on-one help with Canvas? Sign up for a <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/personal-consultations/">personal consultation</a> to meet with an ITS-EdTech member over Zoom! You can also <a href="https://help.unc.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">submit a help request</a> if you would like to schedule a departmental training.</p>
<h4>Group Training</h4>
<p>See what <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/workshops/">workshops</a> we’re currently offering to learn more about Canvas with other instructors!</p>
<h4>Self-Help Resources</h4>
<p>See <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/moving-from-sakai-to-canvas/">Moving from Sakai to Canvas</a> for video tutorials and guides to help instructors transition from Sakai to Canvas with tool comparisons between the two systems. This resource provides an overview of commonly used tools for instructors to manage their courses, communicate and share course materials with students, and collect and provide feedback on student work.<a name="site-request"></a></p>
<h2>Request Forms</h2>
<p><strong>Note</strong>: Faculty/Staff Onyen required to access request forms.</p>
<h3>New Site Request Form</h3>
<p><a href="https://checkindash.unc.edu/secure/canvas-request.php" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>New Site Request Form</strong></a>: Submit site requests for a brand new Canvas site for course development or training, instructional, or administrative purposes (committee work, communications, reviews, etc.).</p>
<h3>Additional Sakai to Canvas Migration</h3>
<p>Sakai migrations have been completed for University Registrar courses taught in 2022, 2023, and Spring 2024. The additional migration request form is now closed.</p>
<p><span class="TextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9" lang="EN-US" xml:lang="EN-US" data-contrast="auto"><span class="NormalTextRun SCXW107957399 BCX9"><strong>Note:</strong> If you require any Sakai content from course sites (pre-SP22) or project sites for re-use in Canvas, please refer to instructions on how to <a href="https://edtech.unc.edu/service/canvas/getting-course-content-into-canvas/#export-sakai">migrate content from Sakai yourself</a>.</span></span><a name="guest"></a></p>
<h3>Guest Accounts</h3>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Non-Onyen guest accounts may be created for individuals not eligible for an Onyen account who will serve in instructional, advisory, or other coordinating roles in Canvas sites. Guest accounts can also be created for students from other institutions enrolled in credit-bearing courses at UNC-CH as well as for students enrolled in non-credit bearing courses or training sponsored by a UNC-CH operating unit. Only users with the role of Teacher, TA, Designer, Dean Designate, or Tech Support can create a guest account from their site. <strong>Important</strong>: Once created, active guest accounts are valid indefinitely but will be suspended after one year of inactivity (i.e., user unable to log in) and deleted after four years of inactivity (i.e., all data removed).</span></p>
<div role="tablist" class="panel-group yourcustomclass oscitas-bootstrap-container" id="unc-accordion-0">
<div class="panel panel-default oscitas-bootstrap-container">

    <div id="panel-heading-details-0-0" class="panel-heading oscitas-bootstrap-container" role="tab">

        <h4 class="panel-title oscitas-bootstrap-container">

            <button class="accordion-toggle oscitas-bootstrap-container collapsed" 
                id = "button-details-0-0"
                data-toggle="collapse"
                data-parent="#unc-accordion-0"    
                aria-controls="#details-0-0"  
                aria-expanded="false" 
                href="#details-0-0">
                Access instructions to create a Canvas guest account            </button>

        </h4>

    </div>

    <div id="details-0-0" class="panel-collapse collapse  oscitas-bootstrap-container">

        <div class="panel-body oscitas-bootstrap-container"></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">All UNC-Chapel Hill Faculty, Students, and Staff who have an active Onyen have access to Canvas. Rosters are added automatically to Canvas for official course sites based on enrollment data in ConnectCarolina.</span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">If needed, you may add other UNC-Chapel Hill users to your Canvas sites. For example: tech support, instructional designers, departmental colleagues, or students not on the roster. To do this, go to the site and select People > +People > select Login ID > enter their Onyen > select role > Next > Add User.</span></p>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">Only complete the following steps if you need to </span><a href="https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Instructor-Guide/How-do-I-add-users-to-a-course/ta-p/1119" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span data-contrast="none">add a user to your Canvas site</span></a><span data-contrast="auto"> who </span><b><span data-contrast="auto">does not have an Onyen.</span></b><span data-contrast="auto"> Note: Only Teachers, TAs, Designers, and Tech Support can create users in their sites. </span><span data-ccp-props="{"134233117":false,"134233118":false,"201341983":0,"335551550":1,"335551620":1,"335559685":0,"335559737":0,"335559738":240,"335559739":240,"335559740":259}"> </span></p>
<ol>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to your site where you would like to add a guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Go to <strong>People</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>People+</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select <strong>Login ID</strong></span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Enter the guest’s Email address in the box</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Select a <strong>Role</strong> and <strong>Section</strong> for the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Check the box if the guest should only interact with this section</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> Button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">If the guest does not have an account in Canvas, you will receive the following message: “We were unable to find matches below. Select any you would like to create as new users. Unselected will be skipped at this time.”</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Carefully check the box next to the guest</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Type their Full Name into the Name box (e.g. “First Last”)</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Next</strong> button</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Confirm that the guest’s name and email are correct</span></li>
<li><span data-contrast="auto">Click <strong>Add Users</strong> button</span></li>
</ol>
<p><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will then be added to the site with Pending status. </span><span data-contrast="auto">The guest will also receive an email from Instructure Canvas with steps to create their account. <strong>Important:</strong> The guest should respond that they <strong>Do Not have a Canvas account</strong> (in our UNC-CH instance) if prompted during setup, even if they have one at another institution. </span><span data-contrast="auto">After creating their account, the guest will be able to log into Canvas at canvas.unc.edu using the Non-Onyen Login button. <strong>Note: </strong>Users may be added to sites during the current term but not after courses have concluded.<br />
</span></p>
<p></div>

//Get the button:
mybutton = document.getElementById("topBtn");

// When the user scrolls down 20px from the top of the document, show the button
window.onscroll = function() {scrollFunction()};

function scrollFunction() {
  if (document.body.scrollTop > 20 || document.documentElement.scrollTop > 20) {
    mybutton.style.display = "block";
  } else {
    mybutton.style.display = "none";
  }
}
